Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Australia Day does not commemorate the recognition of Australian citizenship.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Australia Day is the day when all Australians stopped being British citizens, which is not true.
Understate: No instances of understating bias are present in the claim.
Falters at times: No instances of faltering bias are present in the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up its statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Australia Day commemorates the passing of Australian citizenship law.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Australia Day commemorates the arrival of Captain Arthur Phillip in Sydney Cove and the founding of the colony of New South Wales.
